item.title: Please scan the fucking links
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

We don’t have time, based on the activity of this section, to scan every single download. It’s your job to report anything that looks like it could be a virus, and to use some common sense when running downloads.

Read full topic

item.title: Please scan the fucking links
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“curiousgeorge, post:8, topic:445393”][quote author=Travas link=topic=548120.msg4049342#msg4049342 date=1342354858]

Got McAfee, Malwarebytes and Spybot search and destroy. All I’m saying is the server downloads section would benefit from better policing.

Or maybe it’s not the moderator’s fault you downloaded a virus. If you had commonsense, you wouldn’t need mods to ‘police’ this section to keep you safe.
[/quote]

Lol there isn’t such thing as ‘Common sense’ that’s just a lazy way of saying ‘think how I think, but I’m not sure how to explain it’. And did I say I was blaming the moderator’s for downloading a virus? No, I said I was suggesting it may be a good idea to have mods police that section to reduce the number of false posts / virus infected links.[/quote]And if you had common sense, you would see that it’s a virus and not download it. I have seen many servers released with viruses, but I never downloaded them because I have common sense. It’s easy to tell if it’s a virus, if you can’t tell, then you probably shouldn’t be downloading stuff.

Anyway, it’s not a moderators job to ‘police’ every single post. It’s YOUR job to report the post so the moderators can decide upon an action.

Read full topic

item.title: Please scan the fucking links
item.dc:creator: @mazen320 mazen320
item.description:
@mazen320 wrote:

[quote=“curiousgeorge, post:4, topic:445393”]I got a RAT off someone who posted ChaoticScape source or something like that… before I actually accused the person (pkstro) I asked him who his ISP was and he said it was optusnet (I had his IP when he cleaned my acc of 180m). It is too much of a coincidence for him not to be the hacker as

  1. I could not delete the source when I had ran the server (obviously it was maintaining access to my PC)
  2. He even said his ISP was optusnet and I have his IP (just way too much of a coincidence that as soon as I tried to delete the file he shutdown my comp remotely and cleaned my RS acc)
  3. I reckon he used blackshades to shut down the comp remotely as no other process was going to.

End of, what a fucking joke :].[/quote]
Just get avg portecter worked for me when i had a keylogger

Read full topic

item.title: Please scan the fucking links
item.dc:creator: @curiousgeorge curiousgeorge
item.description:
@curiousgeorge wrote:

I got a RAT off someone who posted ChaoticScape source or something like that… before I actually accused the person (pkstro) I asked him who his ISP was and he said it was optusnet (I had his IP when he cleaned my acc of 180m). It is too much of a coincidence for him not to be the hacker as

  1. I could not delete the source when I had ran the server (obviously it was maintaining access to my PC)
  2. He even said his ISP was optusnet and I have his IP (just way too much of a coincidence that as soon as I tried to delete the file he shutdown my comp remotely and cleaned my RS acc)
  3. I reckon he used blackshades to shut down the comp remotely as no other process was going to.

End of, what a fucking joke :].

Read full topic
